DataElement.preferredName: Magnetic Resonance Imaging Diagnostic Imaging Assessment Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The indicator that describes whether or not  imaging that uses radiofrequency waves and a strong magnetic field rather than x-rays was performed.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Magnetic Resonance Imaging Diagnostic Imaging Assessment
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to having imaging that uses radiofrequency waves and a strong magnetic field rather than x-rays to provide amazingly clear and detailed pictures of internal organs and tissues.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Imaging that uses radiofrequency waves and a strong magnetic field rather than x-rays to provide amazingly clear and detailed pictures of internal organs and tissues. The technique is valuable for the diagnosis of many pathologic conditions, including cancer, heart and vascular disease, stroke, and joint and musculoskeletal disorders. :Any method that uses a visual display of structural or functional patterns of organs or tissues for diagnostic evaluation..

Concepts.definition: Imaging that uses radiofrequency waves and a strong magnetic field rather than x-rays to provide detailed pictures of internal organs and tissues. The technique is valuable for the diagnosis of many pathologic conditions, including cancer, heart and vascular disease, stroke, and joint and musculoskeletal disorders.
Any method that uses a visual display of structural or functional patterns of organs or tissues for diagnostic evaluation.

Property.preferredDefinition: Having determined the value, significance, or extent of.

Concepts.definition: The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Unk ND NA Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes, no, unknown, not done or not applicable.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.29 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. ak

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Updated to add NCIt concept relationship. Updated VM Short Name to be the Public ID to be consistent with current convention for VM Short Name - DW 10-03-2022
ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.29 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. ak

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Indicates a task, process or examination that has either not been initiated or completed.

Concepts.definition: Indicates a task, process or examination that has either not been initiated or not been completed.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Unknown Not Done Not Applicable Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.:Indicates a task, process or examination that has either not been initiated or completed.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.
Indicates a task, process or examination that has either not been initiated or not been completed.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: . Modified def to preferred def per caDSR meeting. No versioning needed. AK 2/8/16

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: A diagnostic contrast-enhanced MRI of the brain was performed postoperatively within 72 hours of the resection

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text2
ReferenceDocuments.description: A diagnostic contrast-enhanced MRI of the brain was performed within 28 days of completing radiation and within 7 days prior to registration.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Did the recipient have magnetic resonance imaging?
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did the recipient have magnetic resonance imaging?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: A diagnostic contrast-enhanced MRI of the brain was performed within 35 days of completing radiation and within 7 days prior to registration.

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF-Text1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did patient have post-operative MRI of the brain?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 01
ReferenceDocuments.description: Was an MRI of the brain (with orbital cuts for optic pathway tumors) with and without contrast performed within 4 weeks prior to enrollment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF TEXT 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Will the patient be able to undergo an evaluation by MRI within 72 hours post surgery  to assess extent of resection

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF TEXT 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Will the patient be able to undergo an evaluation by MRI within 96 hours post surgery to assess extent of resection

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 02
ReferenceDocuments.description: Was an MRI of the brain (with orbital cuts for optic pathway tumors) and/or spine (depending on the site(s) of primary disease) with and without contrast performed within 4 weeks prior to enrollment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 03
ReferenceDocuments.description: Were MRI's of the brain (with orbital cuts for optic pathway tumors) and/or spine (depending on the site(s) of primary disease) with and without contrast performed within 4 weeks prior to enrollment?

DataElement.changeDescription: . System generated def displayed as alt def.  Added AQT for 2034. AK 5/19/15. AQT added for 2137r3. 06/28/2021 KMM
